contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|illegal|illegally|extralegal|unlawful}} '''Illegal''', or '''unlawful''', is used to describe something that is prohibited or not authorized by '''[[law]]'''. '''Illegal''' may also refer to: * Law ** [[Crime]], the practice of breaking the law ** An illegal immigrant - see [[illegal immigration]] ** Illegal [[resident spy]] * Entertainment ** [[Illegal (1932 film)|''Illegal'' (1932 film)]], a British film ** [[Illegal (1955 film)|''Illegal'' (1955 film)]], an American film ** [[Illegal (2010 film)|''Illegal'' (2010 film)]], a 2010 Belgian film ** [[Illegal (group)]], a 1990s rap group ** [[Illegal (song)|"Illegal" (song)]], a track from pop singer Shakira's 2005 release, ''Oral Fixation Vol. 2'' ==See also== <!-- Whether this entry really belongs on the disambiguation page or not is a borderline case, but I thought it might be useful. Feel free to remove it if you consider it irrelevant. In any case it shouldn't be included in the main list of "things named 'illegal'". --> * [[Illegal Art]], a record label * [[Illegal drug trade]] * [[Illegal fishing]] * [[Illegal immigration]] * [[Illegalism]], an anarchist philosophy which openly embraced criminality as a lifestyle {{disambiguation}}
